review: We have been at the Hamburg RR twice now, and I am giving them a 3-star rating based on the average of both visits. The food is always good. The service was fair to good during our first visit.  During today's visit, the service left a lot to be desired. We received a friendly greeting were seated, and our orders taken promptly.  We got our appetizer quickly and had enough time to enjoy it before our dinners arrived.  On the negative side, the waitress got my order wrong and then I was nearly done with the rest of my meal before she brought the right item. My husband asked for a second refill on his soda, which never came. And they left the emptied dishes sit on our small table rather than clearing them, even though we placed them in an obvious spot for removal. We enjoy RR's menu, and I'm hoping the Hamburg RR team improves their service.  :-)

I have always received terrific, prompt service with a smile.  The meal has always been the right temperature and my drink refilled in a timely manner.  I'll continue to make this a stop for my lunch breaks.

Don't bother asking for a medium rare burger, they can't figure that out. I sent a cold over cooked burger back and in return I got a slightly warmer still overcooked burger.  Pray you don't get Mallory as a waitress, she is by far the worst waitress I have ever had and I have had a lot! I could barely hear her speak, and in a loud environment as RR always is that is not a good thing. We had to wait 20 minutes for our drinks. When she finally arrived with them she had drinks for FOUR tables on one tray. So people who sat down 10 minutes after I did got their drinks at the same time.  After that three tables (one of which was a Mallory table) who sat down after we did got their food before we did.  I asked to see a manager. Right after I complained about waiting 45 minutes and then receiving a cold overcooked burger and missing a salad, another table of Mallory's did the same thing. After this fiasco they did comp me the burger but with everything that happened I feel they should have comped my whole check!

This is definitely going into my Good Burger List. We randomly found this place on our way to Hershey from NYC. Needless to say, Red Robin does not exist in NYC and when we stopped in Hamburg, we picked this place because it was either McDonald's, Wendy's, Taco Bell, and Red Robin.  We were not disappointed. My boyfriend ordered the chicken salad something-something. It was huge and we figured out pretty quickly that it probably had more calories than my burger, but boy was it good! Comfort food in a salad! I ordered the original burger and asked for a SMALL side of fries. The side was small (exactly 10 steak fries) and asked for the onion strings in the burger. The whole thing was amazing, and I wanted to say yes when the waitress asked me if I wanted more fries, but I had to refuse.  Cool place!

Greeted nicely, sat quickly, order taken fast. Good start. Then burger came without side of sweet potato fries. Half way through hamburger before fries arrived. Now to the hamburgers...not juicy but dry and extremely salty. Will skip this place next time.

Solid three stars. Second time here. First time abt a year ago. This time sat at the bar. Turkey burger. House salad. French fries. Some sort of hot apple pie wedges for dessert. Coke to drink. Great service. Good solid casual dining experience. 22$ before tip. My one observation: for $22 I prefer a real plate for my burger and fries (of which there were too few) rather than a plastic basket. Seemed a little too casual at that price point. Maybe ok for kids but not for an adult. Large holiday tip for the server who was pleasant and efficient at the same time. Good place for a meal after a quick trip in to the nearby monster Cabelas store. Which itself is worth a visit if you have never been and are into that type of merchandise.

food is consistent throughout the chain for Red Robins'.  This one is next to one of the largest outdoor / hunting stores and people like to get a quick bite to eat prior to going shopping.  Service is friendly, somewhat attentive, but they provide everything you ask.

I have been to this Red Robin a few times.  I have alway's enjoyed whatever I ordered. The service has always been fast and friendly. If you sign up for eClub program you get a free Birthday burger. This location does not participate in the Red Robin Royalty program. Decent place for a burger.

My family is a big red robin fan.  There are none in my home town so when we are away and we see one we usually stop.  Burgers are good and they have a new table top device that allows my 4yo to play games which is great.  Stopped at Cabela's amd decided to eat here. My visit here was as expected.  Service was fast and server was very attentive.  Loved it!
This place was great! Try the Berserker burger. Our server Cyndi was the best!
pretty decent burgers.  good fries.  touch screen ordering on the table was pretty cool.

There is a Mac Donald close to it, just go there!! You will spend less and you will eat much better ! All the burgers here are to much fried and with too much oil, the service is not bad but nothing special . Sorry guys you have to work harder !!
Great burgers. Have variety of buns, including gluten free and lettuce wrapped. Great friendly service.

Great atmosphere, the staff was so energetic, courteous and and friendly! Sat at the bar and enjoyed being served by Bryana!  We had good conversation and I felt like she sincerely cared about her customers.  I look forward to visiting this location in the future! Only one negative point, there was an off duty employee hanging around and although they weren't very busy his grab ass antics were too childish and distracting.

the burgers was so good and the people was nice. Great place to go after Hersey park. The place is spotless and very great decor. I love the mini screen you can pay your bill there and reorder things like the unlimited fries and  drinks :)

We have visited this Red Robin on numerous occasions and have only had one negative experience (which was right when it first opened).  The servers have always been friendly and the food tasty!  One time, we were there and the menu had changed since our last visit.  They removed one of my husband's favorite items.  My husband asked the manager why they removed - just being curious. A few minutes later, the manager came back and offered to make my husband it even though it wasn't on the menu anymore - that's great service!

First time to a red robin.  I let my son choose where we ate and this is where he chose.  The food was great.  My burger was cooked perfectly.   The waitress was amazing.   She took the time to make sure my son, who is very soft spoken, got his burger exactly what he wanted.  We will be coming here more often on our boys night outs to Cabellas.

First time I've been to a Red Robin in years and this place was great.  It was clean, had friendly staff,  and amazing food.  Staff was great and food came out fast...  I would recommend  this place to anyone
We finally found a fairly quick clean place to eat reasonable food on our drive to and from Harrisburg,  PA.

Love Red Robin, I have never had a bad experience here at this location.  Service has always been top notch, burgers have always been solid.  Salads are huge and always good.  I have only ever had one thing i didn't like (their fish and chips was not to my liking, and I love fish and chips). Fries are bottomless, and I have always been given a second order before my first order is even empty, with out asking. Beer is always cold and the deserts (if you can fit it in) are out of this world. Touch screen to order appraisers, refills, deserts and pay your bill are a nice add. I do wish I could get my burger Rare, but that is not a request many places will fill these days. (Darn political correctness)  All in all, it is our goto burger place, and I would recommend it to anyone. YUMM!

First time visiting this chain and I couldn't get over how good the burgers were.. The onion rings are really slamming and beer selection was great. I gotta say we did the burger with the egg on it which was on the sunny side up style something I never tried before and man it hit the spot.. outstanding! Most places serve a burger with a fried egg.. Red Robin went into the dark side and did there's with a runny yoke drenched egg to really fill out the taste and make this burger perfect! While some might not even eat a burger with an egg on it let a lone a egg that is runny with yoke we were impressed. Server wise rocked.. the guy had a great sense of humor and the little one with us loved the video games.. I'm a Red Robin fan from here on out! 4 star's all day long.

The food here was very good!!!! Every thing came out in a timely manner, and I like that the appitzer actually came out before the meal. About 8 months ago this restaurant was a pile of crap, but they really got their crap together for 1pm on a saturday! I got seated in 10 minutes when it was full. Our waitress was super friendly. Servings were a nice size, the riblets could be bigger but I guess that's why they're called riblets haha.  All in all, so much better!!!!

Although they messed up our order and we had to wait a long time in the to-go area outside, the manager was extremely friendly and apologetic. They also compensated us with gift cards for a future visit. The burnin love burgers are a favorite of ours at Red Robin made with garden veggie burgers.  Love their onion rings as well.
The staff here is clueless, they could care less about your experience and the cooks are horrible. Over salted food, late service, you name it - it was bad.

I really do love it here. Close to my house so we frequent. Great burgers and did you no you could sub bottomless side salad instead of bottomless fries? Service is also really really good here too. I can honestly say I've never had a bad meal at red Robin

This location is especially crowded and loud compared to others I have been to. Burgers are good, as expected from a Red Robin, but they are pretty pricey at $9-10 apiece. I have stopped coming to this place in favor of Five Guys just down the street for convenience and price, but the service here is always quite friendly.

Overall good quality food. Not the worlds greatest but I do like the whiskey river barbecue burger and adding ghost pepper sauce. The ghost pepper sauce is a lot milder than I thought it would be though. Most ghost pepper sauces are a lot hotter. The sweet potato fries are really good as well.

Not impressed with this location. We love Red Robins but we won't come back to this one. The burgers were greased, the one slice bacon on a bacon cheese burger was under cooked and chewy. The "Big Chrunch" was anything but not, basically a cheese burger with a few nacho chip strips in it. Our server was too busy socializing near the kitchen to attend to customers. Service here is sub par. Go some where else, dont waste you time or money here.

We have visited a few times and have only had one good experience. I think our last visit was just that. A last visit. the staff is very slow. Sometimes non existent, and seems to be very much against the membership plan. We have never been asked if we are members, have had to beg for our benefits, and when my daughter was there on a date was told she shouldn't use ours, she should open her own. So the store would like like they were signing people up. She never did get to use it. They basically said no way. She was too intimidated to insist. Our last trip there, a waitress came out and said our waitress was occupied, and she took our drink order. This was after waiting over 10 minutes. Our waitress finally came out and took our order. Service was slow even though the place was half empty. She took forever to bring the check and at that point we didn't want to even bring up the benefits card. Maybe that was the point? No $5 off for us. Never going back, we will stick to the location by my parents' house in Pennsylvania. The service there is excellent.

On assignment in Hamburg. Stopped by after the job was completed and had a wonderful chicken sandwich and fries. And then more fries. Friendly staff and service with a smile. Would definitely go there again when I'm in the area.
$10 gourmet burger? yeah ok. ground chuck with seasoning. Been here a few times, very crowded, waitress are friendly, fries are salty. Has a good atmosphere, but is noisy
Good food, but crapshoot on quality of service. It's great you have the computer for check out but service can still be slow. For Togo, we've never had our order right the first time out the door.

Slow service. Took 10 minutes to get our drinks and almost 20 to get our burgers with fries.  Burgers were only warm which means they sat in the window for a few minutes.  Cramps started not even a 45 minutes later and now 2 hours later I'm stuck on a toilet which has only happened 3 times in my 28yr life.  (TGI twice, and Longhorn once).

Overall: good Food was prepared nicely. Tasted good and was plentiful. They have unlimited fries and fruit salad. The sweet potato fries are really good  Service: good. Our server (Brett) was very attentive and helpful  Beer is very cold, as it should be.

This location is awesome! Great food and service. Their burgers are amazing. The prices are average. They have ziosks that make life easier. You can browse the menu, order apps, and pay your check right at the table!
The meal was great as well as the service. We were there in the mid-afternoon so it was quieter. I didn't like sitting near the somewhat noisy kitchen though.
Never had a good meal there. Service is ok.  Atmosphere noisy.  Burgers are greasy & over sauced .....fries are always undercooked.

This is what'd you expect at any red robin. Bottomless fries are the best, especially when dipped in campfire sauce. Don't let the silver cup they put them in discourage you. Feel like I gotta use the toilet now though.

I have definitely been to better Red Robins no doubt there. We walked in and not trying to be funny or cute but the whole place smelled like a big fart. Really what it smelled like was rotten eggs or sulfur. Not sure what it was but the smell lingered the entire time we ate. It was not great, but we were in a rush and didn't feel like getting up and leaving so that is my own fault for sitting in it. Service was meh at best. It was 2pm on a Thursday, needless to say it wasn't busy but it took quite awhile for our food and our drinks to ever get refilled. I think the little ipads that they have installed on tables has actually cut down on service across the board at Red Robin. Overall the food tastes the same as every other Red Robin in the country. But I wouldn't come back to this one as this area is usually a pit stop and I want to be in and out quick.

For a chain, it never disappoints and is a good go to for tiny Hamburg, especially with kids.  My go-tos are the guacamole bacon burger and boneless wings... the chicken comes with blue cheese crumbles and homemade chips.  Fast, friendly service.  They also have a yummy coctail made with fireball whiskey and peach puree.  Sooooo good.

It was super busy last night, and a fun environment. The wait was only about 20 minutes so not bad at all. Our sever Bo was on it and very friendly. I absolutely enjoyed my sweet potato fries! We loved our food and overall had a wonderful experience.
The food is fine but the bottomless fries or salad is a laugh....because the service is sloooow.

Been to a few across the country and a lot of them,  i wasnt impressed. Here i got outstanding service, great atmosphere and my ghost burger was awesome....oh and the beers where tasty to. I recommened this location;-)  Update ...stopped in again and same great service at the bar. Had the big tavern burger and a feww tasty drinks. Bre was my bar maid both night i stopped in and she is a wonderfuland pleasent person to deal with. I enjoyed the talk , drinks , and the single serving friend for both nights. Thanks Bre and Red Robin!

I've been to Red Robin dozens of times over the years, and always have had a good experience. I visited this location on Memorial Day after the Hamburg carnival.  The staff was friendly, even though it felt like some of them didn't want to be there. It being Memorial Day though, that was understandable. All the food was enjoyable and served in a timely manner. You can't go wrong with the onion ring tower and one of their juicy signature burgers! There are better choices to get a good burger, especially in the Lehigh Valley, but as far as chains go, Red Robin is one of my favorites!

Great place to eat, I have never had a bad experience here, and the food is great and they have some of the best servers I have ever had, they are very happy, enthusiastic, polite, and check on you just enough to keep from being annoying. I would definitely recommend going here.

4 stars for the food.  3.5 for the service. Not that the service was bad at all. BUT when a "server" (I.e. someone who is supposed to serve you) takes your order and then is NOT the person who "serves" your food, the tip is the bare minimum.  15% and before tax.  How can I give a great tip when there are two people vying for my tip and neither one is doing the entire job?  This other person delivers my food and then within one minute the original server comes by to ask me how everything is.  If she is that close behind the delivery person why didn't she just pick up my food, deliver it, and asked me how everything is?  I know, I know..  corporate would say they are trying to ensure that my food is delivered as fresh as possible, or some other BS cooked up by the millennial hipsters back at HQ.  Would another minute really matter?  You're serving hamburgers and fries, not soufflé. Don't worry, Red Robin..  this isn't just you.  All the chains do it and I treat them all the same. All that said, the burgers and fries are good. Bathrooms are clean but I am somewhat confused as to why there is a TV in the men's room.  Why not the women's room?  I suppose our NASCAR loving brethren can't miss a single minute.  Are you really going to stand there and pee and turn your neck hard left so as to not miss anything?  Are you going to sit in the stall and watch through the crack in the door?  When Jimmy Joe Bob finishes the race while you're in the head are you going to yell "Yee Haw!" In the rest room?  Is this a family restaurant or a sports bar?  Maybe those millenial hipsters back at HQ really have no idea. All in all a good place and I'll be back. Note to HQ;. ditch the "server sharing" so I can ensure that if my waitress (ooops I said "waitress"..  how UN politically correct I am) does a good job and warrants a good tip that she will receive it.
Red Robin one of those great hamburger joints. There two appetizers a good and the burgers are even better. I always like to go here when visiting Pennsylvania and going to Cabela's
Great service.  Wonderful salads.  Our server Michael was very friendly and took great care if us.  Great stop for dinner on a long trip!  Only downfall was the air conditioning was too cold.
Great food with lighter options, bottomless fries (sweet potato, regular or garlic fries). Also enjoy the atmosphere and service!
The food is good and the wait time is very quick. Our server Adam was more that great and so was his doppelganger Michael.

I often stop at this location for lunch or dinner after shopping at Cabela's. We went at 4 pm on a Saturday and the place was crowded but we were able to be seated right away. The service was alright throughout the meal, although our waitress disappeared for long periods of time when we needed a drink refill. My boyfriend wanted to order the spinach artichoke dip but I was a little leery about this because the last time we ordered this (at the Collegeville location) we were given a tiny ramekin of 4 spoonfuls of dip and had to ask for more dip as we felt we were being cheated paying 7.99 for such a minuscule amount. Thankfully, this location served a much larger bowl of dip and we did not need to ask for more but unfortunately, the dip was lukewarm. Our burgers were delicious- I got the Wild West buffalo and my boyfriend got the Whiskey River BBQ. The fries were perfect. You must try the campfire sauce with your fries! Now for the ugly...the ladies bathroom was dirty and out of the three available stalls one was out of order on a Saturday night. Hopefully this was just a one-off. We would be back because the service and food was decent.
Exactly what I wanted. It was a great burger and fries. Friendly service. Will stop there the next time I'm passing through

A perfect example of a restaurant more concerned with image than providing good quality food for a fair price. The dining room was attractive and clean. The service though highly scripted was attentive.  The food was horrible. There is no excuse for poorly prepared burgers at a burger restaurant. My server asked how I would like my burger cooked... medium rare please was delivered as well done. My wife and ordered a veggie burger that was  described as grilled... it was a pasty partially raw inedible product. The fries were undercooked as well.  For us Red Robin became Dead Robin. As much attentions needs to be paid to the food as was paid to the concept... a good concept does not fill ones belly. The manager was very professional and responsive to the situation. Thank you

Stopped by on the way to Philly.. we were starved, and this Red Robin hit the spot.  BF got a double tavern burger, and I got the mushroom burger on wheat, with a veggie patty (no, I'm not a vegetarian but have been ordering this since I WAS a vegetarian, and it is still my fave).  My shroom burger had sooo many mushrooms, I soooo happy.   We also got a delicious short stack with onion rings (Red Robin has my fave onion rings with honey mustard).  Everything was great, service was great.. would definitely be back if I was hungry and craving a burger in the area.

It looked like our waitress or the entire back-end of the restaurant was having a bad day. The service was slow and the staff appeared disorganized. The restaurant was at capacity and there was a wait for a table. Our appetizer order was forgotten and then finally delivered at the end of our meal. I ordered the Avo-Cobb-O salad which had large strips of chicken. No knives were delivered to the table. Either have the kitchen cut up the chicken into chunks or make sure you provide appropriate silverware for the meal. The server said she had to check to see if she could find a knife. Umm, we are at a sit-down restaurant right? I thought knives would be commonplace. I had to wait about 5 minutes for the knife. Only half the amount of straws were placed on the table for the amount of drinks we ordered. Waited so long for the straws that we just drank our beverages without them. The manager preemptively came to our table to apologize for the service.  Now for some positives! The food was very good and just about the same price as taking our family of 5 to smashburger or 5 guys.  My daughter loves any place that has a gluten free bun for her burger so we will definitely give Red Robin another chance.  Gradewise, I give them an A+ for gluten free food options, A for food quality and price, and a C for service on this particular day.

This is a Great Place, No an AMAZING place.  The staff is excellent, well trained in food allergies ( I have Celiac ), very professional, clean, super clean for such a hi volume place. And they have kept me safe all the dozens of times I have stopped in while traveling through the area.  This is my goto place now.  Right near Cabelas, Thank you Red Robin and your Hamburg staff for always taking good care of me and keeping me safe.

I don't know what this location does, but they are definitely one of the better locations in terms of service and availability of menu options. They also have a non Boca vegan burger with sweet potato fries which is a nice switch up. Eating a Boca burger in comparison to everyone else's burgers is such a tease! Yeah, I know the carnivores are laughing, ha ha. At least they are considerate of those with restrictive diets.  The service is consistent and friendly. They don't ignore you or forget your order.  So, if you're craving RR, this location is decent. What would make me give a higher rating is if they had a better beer selection. I just think good beer is crucial with a good burger recipe.
